data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Last month a fifty-eight year old patient came to me. High blood pressure. Stiff arteries. Doctor said he needed medication.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: I gave him a list. Five Japanese foods.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Three months later his arterial age dropped twelve years. No pills.
data.broll_query: happy healthy man smiling confident outdoor
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Today I will show you exactly what was on that list.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But first you need to understand why American arteries age faster than Japanese arteries.
data.broll_query: elderly american man vs japanese elder comparison healthy
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In my country we have half the heart disease rate of United States. Half.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: And it is not genetics. My Japanese patients who move to America develop same problems within ten years.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: The difference is inflammation. Your arteries are like garden hose.
data.broll_query: garden hose water flowing outdoor close up
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: When inflammation builds up inside the hose becomes stiff. Narrow. Blood cannot flow freely.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: You feel cold hands. Tired legs. Brain fog in afternoon.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: This is not normal aging. This is poor circulation crying for help.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But Japanese elders in their seventies eighties have arteries fifteen years younger than their calendar age.
data.broll_query: active japanese elderly couple walking garden smiling
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Here is why. Five foods. Let me show you the first one.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number one. Natto. Fermented soybeans.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: I know. It looks strange. Smells unusual. Texture is sticky.
data.broll_query: natto sticky strings pulling apart close up
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But in my family we eat this every single morning for seventy years.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Because natto contains nattokinase. This is enzyme that dissolves fibrin.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Fibrin is protein that forms blood clots. Small clots block your circulation even when you do not feel them.
data.broll_query: blood clot formation medical visualization microscopic
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Nattokinase breaks down these clots naturally. Like small worker cleaning your pipes from inside.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Studies show it works as well as aspirin for thinning blood. But it is food not medication.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: How to eat. One small bowl in the morning. Mix with soy sauce mustard and rice.
data.broll_query: natto bowl rice soy sauce japanese breakfast setting
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Start small. Half bowl if taste is too strong. Your palate will adapt within two weeks.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: That patient I mentioned. He started with natto three times per week. Now he eats it daily.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But this next one is even simpler. You probably walked past it in grocery store hundred times.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number two. Shiitake mushrooms.
data.broll_query: fresh shiitake mushrooms wooden board market display
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Not regular white mushrooms. Shiitake specifically. The brown ones with umbrella cap.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: These contain compound called eritadenine. Very hard to pronounce. Very easy to understand what it does.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Eritadenine lowers LDL cholesterol. The bad kind that sticks to your artery walls.
data.broll_query: cholesterol plaque arterial wall medical 3d cross section
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In Japan we use dried shiitake in miso soup every morning. The drying process actually concentrates the nutrients.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Fresh shiitake works too. Slice them thin. Add to any soup stir fry or broth.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Eat them three to four times per week minimum. Your liver will start producing less bad cholesterol naturally.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: One of my patients dropped his cholesterol forty points in three months. Just from adding shiitake to breakfast.
data.broll_query: blood test results cholesterol numbers declining chart
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: His doctor was confused. Asked what medication he was taking. He said mushroom soup.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now number three. This one surprised even me when I first read the research.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Wakame seaweed. The dark green ribbons you see in miso soup.
data.broll_query: wakame seaweed floating miso soup bowl closeup
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Most Americans think seaweed is just decoration. In Japan we know it is medicine.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Wakame contains iodine and potassium. Both regulate blood pressure by helping kidneys release excess sodium.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But here is the part that shocked researchers. Wakame also contains fucoxanthin.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: This compound literally tells your blood vessels to relax. Like gentle massage from inside.
data.broll_query: relaxed dilated blood vessels medical visualization flowing
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: When vessels relax blood pressure drops. Heart does not work so hard. Circulation improves everywhere.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: You can buy dried wakame in any Asian market. Soak in water five minutes. Add to salads soups.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Or buy wakame salad already prepared. Sesame dressing. Eat as side dish three times per week.
data.broll_query: wakame seaweed salad sesame seeds bowl ready eat
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: One tablespoon dried wakame gives you full day supply of iodine. Your thyroid needs this for metabolism.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Better metabolism means less fat in blood. Less fat means cleaner arteries.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now the fourth food. This one is controversial in West but essential in Japan.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Green tea. Not the bottled kind with sugar. Real brewed green tea.
data.broll_query: traditional japanese green tea ceremony pouring teapot
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Matcha or sencha. Both work. Both contain catechins.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Catechins are antioxidants that protect your artery lining from oxidative damage.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Think of rust forming on metal. Oxidation does same thing to your blood vessels. Makes them stiff brittle.
data.broll_query: rusty metal pipe corroded damaged close up texture
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Catechins stop this rust before it starts. Keep vessels flexible young.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But here is what most people do not know. Green tea also relaxes blood vessels immediately.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Within thirty minutes of drinking one cup your arteries dilate. Blood flows easier. You feel warmer.
data.broll_query: person drinking green tea feeling relaxed warm satisfied
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In my practice I tell patients drink two to three cups daily. Between meals not with food.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Why not with food. Because tannins in tea block iron absorption. Drink one hour before or after eating.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Use water at seventy to eighty degrees Celsius. Not boiling. Boiling destroys catechins.
data.broll_query: thermometer water temperature kettle pouring tea preparation
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Steep for two to three minutes. Longer makes it bitter but does not add more benefit.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: That fifty-eight year old patient. He replaced morning coffee with matcha. Said his afternoon energy completely changed.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: No more crash at three PM. No more cold hands at desk.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now the fifth food. This is secret of Okinawa centenarians.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: The people who live past one hundred years with clear minds and strong hearts.
data.broll_query: okinawa japan elderly centenarians smiling healthy active
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Bitter melon. In Japanese we call it goya.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: I will be honest. The taste is very bitter. Most Westerners hate it at first.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But what it does for your blood sugar is remarkable. And blood sugar is everything for circulation.
data.broll_query: blood glucose meter testing finger prick diabetes check
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: When blood sugar stays high it damages artery lining. Like sandpaper rubbing inside your vessels every day.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: This damage attracts cholesterol. Cholesterol sticks to damaged areas. Plaque forms. Arteries narrow.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Bitter melon contains compounds that act like natural insulin. Help cells absorb sugar from blood.
data.broll_query: cells absorbing glucose insulin receptor medical animation
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Less sugar in blood means less damage. Less damage means cleaner arteries. Simple.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In Okinawa they eat goya stir fried with eggs and tofu. Called goya chanpuru.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: The eggs and protein reduce bitterness. You can also find bitter melon tea or capsules.
data.broll_query: bitter melon tea bags capsules supplements bottles
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Start small. Quarter cup twice per week. Let your taste adapt slowly. Your arteries do not care about taste.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p1

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now let me show you how to combine these five foods into simple daily practice.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: You do not need to eat all five every day. That would be overwhelming.
data.broll_query: overwhelmed person looking confused stressed kitchen
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In Japan we follow principle called hara hachi bu. Eat until eighty percent full.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Same with these foods. Do eighty percent. Not perfect. Just consistent.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Here is my recommended schedule. Morning. One bowl natto with rice. One cup green tea.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: If natto is too difficult start with miso soup with wakame and shiitake instead.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Afternoon. Second cup of green tea. Between lunch and dinner.
data.broll_query: person drinking green tea afternoon relaxed peaceful moment
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Dinner. Add shiitake to any meal. Soup. Stir fry. Grilled. Does not matter.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Twice per week add bitter melon. Stir fried or as tea.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: That is it. Simple. No complicated recipes. No expensive supplements.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now let me address common questions my patients ask.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Question one. What if I am on blood thinners like warfarin.
data.broll_query: blood thinner medication pills bottle prescription label
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Very important. Natto can interact with warfarin. Talk to your doctor first.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Do not stop medication without medical supervision. These foods work with medicine not instead of medicine.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Question two. Can I buy supplements instead of eating actual foods.
data.broll_query: supplement pills bottles vitamins pharmacy shelf display
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: You can. Nattokinase supplements exist. Green tea extract exists.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But whole foods contain hundreds of compounds that work together. Supplements give you one or two.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In traditional medicine we call this synergy. The whole is greater than parts.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: My advice. Try real foods first. If taste is impossible then consider supplements.
data.broll_query: person tasting new food making face trying acceptance
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Question three. How long before I see results.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Most patients feel warmer hands and feet within two weeks. More energy within one month.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Blood pressure improvements show up at six to eight weeks.
data.broll_query: blood pressure monitor reading normal healthy numbers
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Cholesterol changes take three to four months. This is not quick fix. This is lifestyle.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Remember that fifty-eight year old patient. His arterial age dropped twelve years in three months.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But he was consistent. Every single day he followed this protocol.
data.broll_query: determined man meal prep kitchen organizing healthy food
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Question four. Where do I buy these foods in America.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Any Asian market will have natto wakame shiitake. Usually in refrigerated or dried section.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Green tea you can find anywhere. Whole Foods. Trader Joes. Even regular supermarket.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Bitter melon is harder. Asian or Indian markets usually have it fresh or frozen.
data.broll_query: bitter melon fresh produce section asian market display
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: If you cannot find fresh bitter melon Amazon sells dried tea and supplements.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now let me tell you what happened to that patient after six months.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: He came back for follow up. His doctor ran full panel. Lipids. Blood pressure. Inflammation markers.
data.broll_query: medical test results papers doctor reviewing comprehensive bloodwork
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Everything improved. LDL cholesterol down forty-two points. Blood pressure from one forty over ninety to one twenty over seventy-five.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But most important. His C-reactive protein dropped from eight to two.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: C-reactive protein measures inflammation. High inflammation means high risk for heart attack stroke.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: His inflammation was now in normal range. Just from food.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: His Western doctor said quote I do not know what you are doing but keep doing it.
data.broll_query: doctor smiling nodding approval impressed satisfied
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: That is power of traditional wisdom meeting modern science.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: But I must be honest with you about limitations.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: These five foods are not magic. They will not reverse fifty years of damage in three months.
data.broll_query: realistic expectations timeline healing process gradual improvement
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: If you have severe blockage you need medical intervention. Stents. Surgery. Medication.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: These foods work best for prevention and early stage problems. Mild high blood pressure. Borderline cholesterol.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: They also work beautifully alongside medication. Not replacing it.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In Japan we believe in both. Western medicine for crisis. Eastern wisdom for daily life.
data.broll_query: traditional japanese medicine meets modern western hospital integration
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now let me share three mistakes I see Americans make with these foods.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Mistake one. Buying sweetened green tea from bottle. This defeats entire purpose.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Sugar causes inflammation. Green tea reduces inflammation. You cannot have both.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Brew your own tea. No sugar. Maybe little lemon if you need flavor.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Mistake two. Eating natto once and giving up because of texture.
data.broll_query: person making disgusted face tasting natto first time
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Your palate needs time to adapt. In Japan babies eat natto. They learn to love it.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Try mixing with strong flavors first. Soy sauce. Mustard. Green onions. Rice.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: After two weeks your brain will stop fighting the stickiness. Trust the process.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Mistake three. Expecting instant results and quitting after one week.
data.broll_query: impatient person checking watch looking frustrated disappointed
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Your arteries did not become stiff overnight. They will not become flexible overnight.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Give it twelve weeks minimum. Mark calendar. Commit to three months.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: After three months get blood work done. See objective proof. Numbers do not lie.
data.broll_query: blood test vial laboratory medical testing scientific proof
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Now let me give you bonus tip that makes everything work better.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Walk after meals. Just ten to fifteen minutes.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: In Japan we call this sanpo. Post-meal walk. It helps blood sugar stay stable.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: When blood sugar stays stable arteries stay clean. Foods work better. Everything compounds.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Combine these five foods with gentle movement and you have complete circulation protocol.
data.broll_query: holistic health lifestyle diet exercise balance harmony
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: This is how my grandparents lived to ninety-seven and ninety-four. Sharp minds. Strong hearts.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: They never counted calories. Never went to gym. Just walked daily and ate these foods.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Let me recap the five foods one more time so you remember.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number one natto. Dissolves clots naturally. Eat in morning with rice.
data.broll_query: natto bowl rice traditional japanese breakfast recap
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number two shiitake mushrooms. Lowers bad cholesterol. Add to soups three times per week.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number three wakame seaweed. Regulates blood pressure. Mix into salads or miso.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number four green tea. Protects arteries from oxidation. Drink two to three cups daily between meals.
data.broll_query: green tea cup steaming peaceful moment recap
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Number five bitter melon. Controls blood sugar. Eat twice per week stir fried or as tea.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Dr_Arasato
data.text: Start with one food this week. Add second food next week. By month three all five become habit. Your arteries will thank you.
data.title: ep_japanese_foods_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: In sixty years of medical practice, I have seen something truly extraordinary that changed how I view brain aging.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Patients who eat these five specific foods show forty percent improvement in memory tests within just eight weeks.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Not medication. Not expensive supplements. Just food. Real food you can buy at any grocery store today.
data.broll_query: fresh produce grocery aisle colorful
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Today I will share exactly what we discovered in Okinawa, where people live past one hundred with remarkably sharp minds.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But first, let me ask you something. Be honest with yourself right now.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: When was the last time you walked into a room and completely forgot why you went there?
data.broll_query: confused elderly woman standing doorway puzzled
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Or maybe you struggled to find the right word in the middle of a conversation. It was right there.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: On the tip of your tongue. But your brain simply would not cooperate. This happens to you, correct?
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Please listen carefully. If you are forgetting names or losing focus, it is not your fault at all.
data.broll_query: compassionate doctor reassuring patient close up
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your brain simply needs specific nutrients it has been missing for years. That is the truth nobody tells you.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Let me explain what is really happening inside your brain right now as we speak.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Sixty-seven percent of people over sixty experience what doctors call mild cognitive impairment. Two out of every three people.
data.broll_query: elderly support group listening attentive faces
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Think about that number for a moment. If you have two friends over sixty, one of you already has it.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But here is what medical schools do not teach doctors about this condition. It is reversible.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your brain is like a garden. Beautiful metaphor, yes? Without the right nutrients, neurons wither like plants without water.
data.broll_query: wilting plant dry soil garden neglected
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They do not die immediately. They simply stop communicating with each other properly. Messages get lost.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This happens because of three things attacking your brain every single day after you turn fifty years old.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: First, neuroinflammation. Your brain cells become inflamed, swollen. Like a sprained ankle, but inside your head.
data.broll_query: inflamed tissue red swelling medical close up
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Second, oxidative stress. Free radicals damage your neurons faster than your body can repair them.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: And third, reduced neuroplasticity. Your brain loses its ability to form new connections and adapt to change.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now stay with me. This is where it gets interesting. Something most neurologists will never tell you.
data.broll_query: attentive audience leaning forward interested engaged
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Certain natural compounds reverse all three of these problems simultaneously. Polyphenols, omega-three fatty acids, specific antioxidants.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: My patients in Okinawa eat these every single day. Not by accident. Not by coincidence. By ancient wisdom.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: So let me introduce you to the first food. This one might genuinely surprise you.
data.broll_query: mysterious covered dish anticipation reveal moment
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Most Americans throw away the most powerful part of this food without even knowing what they are losing.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Wild blueberries. Small, dark, incredibly concentrated. Not the big cultivated ones you see everywhere in supermarkets.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Here is what makes them special. They contain anthocyanins that actually cross the blood-brain barrier.
data.broll_query: blood brain barrier medical illustration protective
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Most nutrients cannot do this. Your brain has a security system. It blocks almost everything.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But anthocyanins get through. And once inside, they increase something called BDNF by thirty-seven percent.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: BDNF stands for brain-derived neurotrophic factor. Think of it as fertilizer for your brain cells.
data.broll_query: fertilizer spreading garden growth plants sprouting
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: It tells your neurons to grow new connections, to communicate better, to stay young and flexible.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Harvard Medical School published a study in twenty twenty-three. Twelve weeks of wild blueberries daily.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Memory improvement averaged forty-one percent. Processing speed increased twenty-eight percent. These are remarkable numbers for any intervention.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But here is the critical part that nobody mentions. You must eat them correctly or they do nothing.
data.broll_query: warning sign caution attention important alert
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: One cup daily. In the morning, when your brain is most receptive to nutrients and ready to absorb.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Frozen is perfectly fine. Actually sometimes better because they are picked at peak ripeness and flash frozen immediately.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Mix them with fat. Greek yogurt, coconut oil, almond butter. Fat helps your body absorb the anthocyanins properly.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Without fat, you absorb maybe twenty percent. With fat, you absorb seventy to eighty percent. Huge difference.
data.broll_query: absorption comparison contrast visual representation difference
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now let me show you something that shocked even me after six decades of practicing medicine.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The second food is something Japanese people eat four times per week. Americans eat it maybe once per month.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Fatty fish. Wild salmon, mackerel, sardines. Rich in omega-three fatty acids EPA and DHA.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your brain is sixty percent fat. Not muscle, not protein. Fat. Specifically, it needs omega-three.
data.broll_query: fish oil capsules spilling omega supplements
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: These fatty acids rebuild your neuron membranes. Like replacing old worn tires with brand new ones.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They also reduce brain inflammation by thirty-five percent according to research from Tokyo University published last year.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: In Okinawa, we have data on this. People who eat fish four times weekly have fifty percent lower Alzheimer's rates.
data.broll_query: elderly okinawan fisherman boat ocean traditional
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Fifty percent. Half the risk. Just from eating fish regularly throughout your life.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Three to four ounces, three times per week minimum. That is your target starting today.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Wild-caught is better than farm-raised. Less mercury, more omega-three, cleaner overall nutrition profile.
data.broll_query: wild salmon swimming river natural habitat
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: And please, do not fry it. Frying oxidizes the omega-three fatty acids and destroys their benefits completely.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Bake, grill, steam. Keep it simple. Japanese style. Respect the food and it will respect your body.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But fish alone is not enough. There is a critical reason why the next food matters so much.
data.broll_query: incomplete puzzle missing piece problem solution
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: It activates what you just ate. Without it, you only get partial benefits from the blueberries and fish.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Leafy greens. Spinach, kale, collard greens, Swiss chard. Dark green leaves packed with folate.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Folate works together with vitamin K to maintain synaptic plasticity. That means your synapses stay flexible and responsive.
data.broll_query: synapse connection neurons communication biological
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They also contain lutein, which protects your gray matter density as you age. Very important after sixty.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Rush University in Chicago tracked nine hundred people for five years. One serving of leafy greens daily.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Their brains aged eleven years slower than people who ate none. Eleven years younger brain age from vegetables.
data.broll_query: calendar pages flipping time reversal aging backwards
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Two cups daily, cooked or raw. Cooking actually preserves folate better if you steam lightly.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Always eat them with fat. Olive oil, avocado, nuts. Vitamin K is fat-soluble. No fat means no absorption.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The fourth food looks simple. But it has a secret power that neuroscientists discovered only recently.
data.broll_query: scientist microscope laboratory discovery research moment
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Walnuts. Seven walnuts daily. That is exactly one ounce, the optimal dose according to research.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They contain ALA, a plant-based omega-three, plus polyphenols that protect your neurons from damage.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But more importantly, they improve processing speed. Your brain works faster, thinks quicker, reacts better.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Think of it like upgrading the wiring in your electrical system. Better connections, faster signals, less resistance.
data.broll_query: electrician rewiring panel upgrade improvement work
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Eat them as a snack between meals. Do not roast them because heat destroys the delicate omega-three.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Raw or soaked overnight in water. That is how we prepare them in traditional Japanese medicine.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now, the fifth food is the most powerful of all. But ninety percent of people prepare it completely wrong.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They destroy its benefits without even knowing. Let me show you the right way before we continue.
data.broll_query: demonstration hands showing proper technique instruction
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This fifth food comes from ancient Japanese tradition. Monks drank it daily for mental clarity and focus.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: We will explore it deeply in the next part. But first, remember these four foods we covered today.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Welcome back. Let me ask you something important before we continue with the fifth food.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Did you write down the first four foods? Blueberries, fatty fish, leafy greens, walnuts. Please do it now.
data.broll_query: hand writing grocery list paper pen notepad
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Because what I am about to share works ten times better when combined with those four.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The fifth food is green tea. Specifically, matcha green tea powder from Japan.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Not regular green tea bags. Matcha is ten times more concentrated and powerful for your brain.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: It contains L-theanine and caffeine working together in perfect harmony. Calm focus without jitters.
data.broll_query: zen garden peaceful calm balanced harmony stone
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: L-theanine increases alpha waves in your brain. The same waves you produce during meditation.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You feel alert but relaxed. Focused but not stressed. This state is optimal for cognitive function.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But there is something even more important. Matcha contains EGCG, a catechin that reduces amyloid plaques.
data.broll_query: molecular structure chemistry science lab research
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Amyloid plaques are the toxic proteins that accumulate in Alzheimer's disease. They strangle your neurons slowly.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Japanese researchers followed four thousand people for eleven years. Those who drank four cups daily.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Sixty-four percent lower risk of cognitive impairment. Almost two-thirds reduction from drinking tea.
data.broll_query: risk reduction graph chart declining statistics positive
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: One to two cups of matcha daily. Morning and early afternoon. Not evening because it contains caffeine.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Here is the critical mistake everyone makes. They use boiling water. This destroys the EGCG completely.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Heat water to one hundred seventy-five degrees Fahrenheit. Not boiling. Use a thermometer if you must.
data.broll_query: thermometer measuring water temperature precise control
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Whisk it properly with a bamboo whisk. This creates tiny bubbles that help absorption in your gut.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now let me show you how to combine all five foods into a practical daily protocol.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This is not complicated. Simple is better. Japanese medicine teaches us that consistency beats perfection.
data.broll_query: simple zen minimalist design clean peaceful space
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Morning, seven to eight AM. Start with one cup of matcha tea prepared correctly at proper temperature.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Thirty minutes later, eat one cup of wild blueberries mixed with Greek yogurt or coconut oil.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The fat from yogurt helps absorb anthocyanins. The matcha helps deliver nutrients across blood-brain barrier.
data.broll_query: nutrients flowing bloodstream medical animation delivery
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Lunch, twelve to one PM. Large salad with two cups of leafy greens, olive oil dressing.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Add grilled salmon or mackerel, three to four ounces. Get your omega-three and folate together.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Mid-afternoon, three to four PM. Seven walnuts. Raw, not roasted. With a second cup of matcha if desired.
data.broll_query: walnut snack afternoon healthy eating mindful
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Dinner, six to seven PM. If you did not have fish at lunch, have it now instead.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Three times per week minimum for fish. Four times is better. Five times is optimal for brain health.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Let me be very honest with you about expectations. This is not a magic pill overnight transformation.
data.broll_query: realistic expectations patience time investment growth
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your brain did not age overnight. It will not reverse overnight either. You must be patient with yourself.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Week one and two. You are setting up habits. Your body is adjusting to new nutrients coming in.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You might notice better sleep quality. Maybe slightly more energy during the day. Subtle changes.
data.broll_query: woman sleeping peacefully bed restful quality sleep
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Week three and four. This is when most people notice real differences in mental clarity and focus.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Words come easier. You remember names better. You can focus on tasks longer without mental fatigue.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Week five through eight. The cumulative effects become very noticeable to both you and people around you.
data.broll_query: friends noticing positive change compliment encouragement support
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Memory tests show measurable improvement. Processing speed increases. This is when the science becomes your reality.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But I must tell you something important about starting this protocol correctly from day one.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Do not try to do everything perfectly all at once. That is Western thinking. It leads to failure.
data.broll_query: overwhelmed person stressed too much pressure anxiety
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Start with two or three foods only. Blueberries and fish, perhaps. Add the others gradually over time.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Small consistent steps always beat big inconsistent efforts. This is wisdom from sixty years of watching patients.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now let me address the questions I know you are thinking right now in your mind.
data.broll_query: thoughtful person considering questions pondering curious
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: What if I cannot afford wild blueberries every single day? They are expensive, I understand completely.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Buy frozen in bulk. Much cheaper. Sometimes even more nutritious because they are flash-frozen at peak ripeness.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: What if I do not like fish or cannot eat it for religious or personal reasons?
data.broll_query: person declining food plate dietary restrictions preferences
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Algae-based omega-three supplements. DHA and EPA from algae, not fish. Vegetarians and vegans use these successfully.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: What if I am already taking medications? Will these foods interact with my prescriptions?
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: These are whole foods, not supplements. Generally very safe. But always discuss with your doctor first, please.
data.broll_query: doctor patient consultation discussion medical advice
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Especially if you take blood thinners. Omega-three and vitamin K can affect clotting. Be cautious and informed.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Let me share something from my own personal experience that might help you stay motivated.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I am seventy-eight years old. I still perform surgery twice per week. My hands are steady.
data.broll_query: surgeon hands steady precise medical operation skill
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I memorize patient charts without notes. I read medical journals every night. My mind is sharp.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This is not genetics. This is not luck. This is these five foods every single day for forty years.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: My colleagues who did not follow this protocol? Many retired early with cognitive problems. Very sad.
data.broll_query: retired doctor struggling memory elderly concerned worried
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The difference is not talent or intelligence. The difference is what you feed your brain consistently.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now I want to show you exactly how to shop for these foods tomorrow morning.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Blueberries. Look for wild, not cultivated. Frozen section is fine. Organic is better but not absolutely necessary.
data.broll_query: frozen blueberries package store label reading selection
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Fatty fish. Wild Alaskan salmon is gold standard. Mackerel and sardines are cheaper and equally effective.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Canned fish works perfectly fine. Just check for low sodium and no added oils or chemicals.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Leafy greens. Fresh or frozen, both work well. Frozen spinach and kale are convenient and affordable.
data.broll_query: leafy greens produce section fresh vegetables colorful
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Walnuts. Raw, unsalted, in bulk bins or packages. Store in refrigerator to prevent oils from going rancid.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Matcha. This is where you invest money. High quality ceremonial grade from Japan. Worth every penny.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Cheap matcha is oxidized and bitter. It does not have the same EGCG content. Quality matters here.
data.broll_query: matcha quality comparison color vibrant dull difference
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your total grocery cost? About forty to sixty dollars per week for all five foods combined.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Less than nine dollars per day to protect your brain and potentially prevent dementia. Best investment possible.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Compare that to memory supplements that cost sixty to eighty dollars monthly and have questionable research behind them.
data.broll_query: supplement bottles expensive price tag marketing claims
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Real food always works better than pills. Nature designed these nutrients to work together synergistically.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Let me give you one final piece of advice that took me decades to truly understand.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your body wants to heal. Your brain wants to be sharp and clear. Give it the tools and it will.
data.broll_query: healing process recovery growth renewal transformation
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You are not broken. You are not defective. You are simply malnourished in specific ways. That is fixable.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Start tomorrow morning. One blueberry smoothie with yogurt. One cup of matcha tea. That is all.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Track your focus and memory for two weeks. Write it down. You will notice the difference yourself.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Thank you for trusting me with your health. Your brain will thank you for listening. Be well, my friends.
data.title: ep_brain_rejuv_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Last month, a 68-year-old patient walked into my office. He looked exhausted, confused.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: He sat down and said: Doctor, I take all my vitamins every morning. Why do I feel worse?
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I asked him to bring his supplement bottles. He came back with a shopping bag. Full.
data.broll_query: hands placing multiple vitamin bottles on table
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I looked at his list. And I saw the problem immediately.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Five of those vitamins were not helping him. They were aging him faster.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I'm Dr. Kenzo Arasato. And today, I'll show you those five vitamins.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Not because they're bad. But because after sixty, your body works differently.
data.broll_query: split screen young person vs senior taking vitamins
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: By the end of this video, you'll know which five vitamins need special attention after sixty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Why they become risky. And what to do instead.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This is not your fault. Your body changed. The advice didn't.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But first, let me explain what happens inside your body after sixty.
data.broll_query: aging process timeline visualization medical
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your kidneys. They've been filtering your blood for six decades. Every single day.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: After forty, your kidney filtration rate drops about one percent every year.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: That means by sixty, you're filtering twenty percent slower than at forty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your liver. Same story. It metabolizes vitamins and medications slower now.
data.broll_query: liver organ metabolism medical visualization 3d
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Think of it like a water filter. After forty years of use, it doesn't clean as fast.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: And here's the critical part. Some vitamins are fat-soluble.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin A, D, E, K. They don't leave your body quickly. They accumulate.
data.broll_query: fat tissue storing vitamins medical illustration
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: At forty, your body handled this easily. At sixty? Different rules.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: And the first vitamin on this list? Most doctors recommend it. But after sixty...
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin A. Essential for vision, immune function, skin health. We all know this.
data.broll_query: vitamin A molecular structure medical
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The recommended daily amount is nine hundred micrograms for men, seven hundred for women.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But here's what the research shows. After sixty, the safe upper limit drops.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Studies from Sweden, Harvard, multiple countries. Same finding.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: High-dose Vitamin A in seniors is linked to bone loss. Increased fracture risk.
data.broll_query: bone density scan showing osteoporosis
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Why? Because Vitamin A accumulates in your liver. And too much interferes with Vitamin D.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin D protects your bones. Vitamin A in excess blocks it.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: My patient? He was taking a multivitamin with fifteen hundred micrograms. Plus cod liver oil.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: That's three thousand micrograms total. Every single day. For three years.
data.broll_query: calendar pages flipping fast forward
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: His bone density scan showed early osteoporosis. He's only sixty-eight.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Here's what you should do. Check your multivitamin label right now.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If it contains more than seven hundred micrograms of Vitamin A, switch.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Better option? Get Vitamin A from beta-carotene sources. Carrots, sweet potatoes, spinach.
data.broll_query: colorful vegetables carrots sweet potatoes display
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your body converts beta-carotene to Vitamin A only when it needs it. Built-in safety mechanism.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You were doing the right thing. Taking care of your health. Nobody told you the limits changed.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin A stores in fat tissue. And the next vitamin? It does the same thing. But worse.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin E. The antioxidant everyone talks about. Protects your cells from damage.
data.broll_query: vitamin E capsules close up macro
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: At reasonable doses, it's beneficial. But here's the problem with Vitamin E after sixty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: High doses increase your bleeding risk. Especially if you take blood thinners.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: How many people over sixty take aspirin? Warfarin? Eliquis? Millions.
data.broll_query: elderly hands holding blood thinner medication
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Add high-dose Vitamin E to that? You're asking for trouble.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: A meta-analysis of nineteen studies. Over one hundred thousand participants. Clear finding.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin E doses above four hundred international units per day increase all-cause mortality.
data.broll_query: statistical chart mortality risk increasing
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: That means higher risk of death from any cause. Heart disease, stroke, everything.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now look at most Vitamin E supplements. They contain four hundred to one thousand IU.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: My recommendation after sixty? Keep it under two hundred international units per day.
data.broll_query: measuring vitamin E dosage dropper bottle
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Get the rest from food. Almonds, sunflower seeds, spinach, avocado.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: One ounce of almonds gives you seven milligrams. That's safe, natural, effective.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But these two vitamins are fat-soluble. They accumulate. The next three? They work differently.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Number three. Iron. Essential for carrying oxygen in your blood. Everyone needs it.
data.broll_query: red blood cells carrying oxygen medical
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But here's what most people don't know. Your iron needs drop significantly after sixty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Women after menopause? You stop losing iron through menstruation. Your needs drop in half.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Men after sixty? Same story. You need much less iron now.
data.broll_query: elderly man vs young man comparison
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The recommended daily amount for adults over sixty is only eight milligrams.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: But check your multivitamin. Many still contain eighteen milligrams. That's for younger women.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Excess iron doesn't just sit harmlessly in your body. It causes oxidative stress.
data.broll_query: iron oxidation rust metaphor cells
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Think of it like rust inside your arteries. Damaging the walls. Increasing inflammation.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Studies link high iron levels to increased risk of heart disease, diabetes, even cancer.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I had a seventy-two-year-old patient. Ferritin level was six hundred. Normal is under two hundred.
data.broll_query: blood test results ferritin levels high
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: He'd been taking iron supplements for twenty years. Because he felt tired.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: His fatigue wasn't from iron deficiency. It was from iron overload.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: We stopped the supplements. Did therapeutic phlebotomy. Removed excess iron.
data.broll_query: patient feeling energetic after treatment
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Six months later? His energy came back. His inflammation markers dropped.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Here's my advice. If you're over sixty, do not take iron supplements without a blood test.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Check your ferritin level first. Most seniors don't need extra iron at all.
data.broll_query: ferritin blood test vial close up
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If you've been taking a senior multivitamin with iron, you're not alone. Millions do.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Iron builds up slowly over years. But vitamin number four? It acts fast.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin B6. Part of the B-complex. Important for brain function, mood, nerve health.
data.broll_query: vitamin B6 molecular structure brain connection
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Most people think: B vitamins are water-soluble, they're safe. You just pee out the extra.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: That's true for Vitamin C. But B6? Different story entirely.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p1

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: At high doses, Vitamin B6 causes nerve damage. Peripheral neuropathy.
data.broll_query: nerve damage neuropathy hands feet medical
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your hands start tingling. Your feet feel numb. You lose balance.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The safe upper limit is one hundred milligrams per day. But damage can occur even lower.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: I see patients taking B-complex supplements with fifty to two hundred milligrams of B6.
data.broll_query: B complex vitamin bottle label closeup
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: They add energy drinks. Pre-workout powders. Each one has more B6.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Before they know it, they're getting three hundred milligrams per day. Every single day.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: A seventy-year-old woman came to me. She couldn't feel her toes. Kept dropping things.
data.broll_query: elderly woman hands trembling dropping object
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: We did nerve conduction studies. Peripheral neuropathy. I asked about her supplements.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: She was taking a B-complex vitamin. Plus a separate B6 supplement for carpal tunnel.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Total B6 intake? Two hundred fifty milligrams daily. For eighteen months.
data.broll_query: timeline calendar months highlighted accumulation
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: We stopped everything. It took nine months for her sensation to return. Nine months.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The recommended daily amount of B6 after sixty? Only one point seven milligrams.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You can get that from chicken, fish, potatoes, bananas. Easily.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If you take a B-complex, keep the total B6 under twenty-five milligrams per day.
data.broll_query: measuring vitamin B6 dosage supplement
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Four vitamins down. And the last one? It's the one people trust the most.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Calcium. The bone health vitamin. Doctors recommend it. Your friends take it. Seems safe, right?
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: High-dose calcium supplements after sixty come with a hidden danger. Arterial calcification.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Calcium is supposed to go to your bones. But without the right cofactors, it goes elsewhere.
data.broll_query: calcium distribution body bones vs arteries
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: It deposits in your arteries. Your heart valves. Your kidneys.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Multiple studies show this. Taking more than one thousand milligrams of calcium per day increases cardiovascular risk.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Especially if you're not taking Vitamin K2 and Vitamin D3 with it.
data.broll_query: vitamin K2 D3 calcium synergy diagram
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin D3 helps you absorb calcium. Vitamin K2 directs it to bones, not arteries.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Most calcium supplements don't include K2. They're incomplete.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: A study from New Zealand. Over one thousand postmenopausal women. Five-year follow-up.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Women taking calcium supplements had higher rates of heart attacks. Higher than the control group.
data.broll_query: heart attack statistics graph comparison
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This doesn't mean calcium is bad. It means how you take it matters.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Here's what I recommend. Get calcium from food first. Dairy, leafy greens, sardines.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If you supplement, take no more than five hundred milligrams at one time.
data.broll_query: calcium supplement single dose capsule
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your body can only absorb about five hundred milligrams at once. The rest is wasted.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Split your dose. Five hundred in the morning. Five hundred at night. With food.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: And always take it with Vitamin K2 and D3. Non-negotiable.
data.broll_query: vitamin combo K2 D3 calcium together
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Calcium confusion is real. Even doctors got this wrong for years. You're not alone.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: So those are the five vitamins. Let me recap them quickly.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin A. After sixty, keep it under seven hundred micrograms. Use beta-carotene sources.
data.broll_query: vitamin A carrots beta carotene natural
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin E. Stay under two hundred international units. Get rest from almonds and spinach.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Iron. Only eight milligrams daily after sixty. Test your ferritin first.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Vitamin B6. Maximum twenty-five milligrams per day. Watch for hidden sources in energy drinks.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Calcium. No more than five hundred milligrams per dose. Always with K2 and D3.
data.broll_query: calcium supplement proper dosage timing
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Now let me give you a simple protocol. What to do starting today.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Step one. Audit your current supplements. Write down every single thing you take.
data.broll_query: person writing supplement list notebook pen
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Include your multivitamin. Individual vitamins. Herbal supplements. Everything.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Step two. Add up the total dose of each nutrient. This is critical.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Many people take a multivitamin plus individual vitamins. They double up without realizing it.
data.broll_query: multivitamin plus individual supplements overlap
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Step three. Compare your totals to the safe limits I just gave you.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If you're over the limit, stop immediately. Switch to a lower-dose option.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Step four. Prioritize food sources. This is always the safest approach.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: A varied diet gives you vitamins in balanced amounts. With natural cofactors.
data.broll_query: variety healthy foods grocery shopping basket
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Step five. Work with your doctor. Get blood tests.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Test your ferritin for iron. Vitamin D levels. Homocysteine for B vitamins.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Don't guess with supplements. Test and know exactly what your body needs.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: My patient I mentioned at the beginning? We did all of this.
data.broll_query: doctor reviewing patient case notes
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: We cut his Vitamin A in half. Stopped the cod liver oil completely.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Lowered his Vitamin E to natural food sources. Eliminated the iron supplement.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Adjusted his B-complex to a senior-friendly formula. Fixed his calcium protocol.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Three months later, he came back. Different person. More energy. Clearer mind.
data.broll_query: elderly man looking energetic healthy smiling
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: His bone scan six months later showed improvement. No more bone loss.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: This doesn't mean vitamins are bad. It means precision matters after sixty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your body is not the same machine it was at forty. The rules changed.
data.broll_query: aging timeline body changes 40s to 60s
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: You've been taking care of yourself. Doing the right thing. Now let's refine the approach.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: One more thing. Let me address a common concern.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: People ask me: Doctor, if I stop these vitamins, won't I become deficient?
data.broll_query: worried patient asking doctor questions
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: No. Because we're not eliminating vitamins. We're optimizing the dose and source.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Lower-dose supplements plus whole foods give you what you need. Without the excess.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Remember: more is not always better. Especially after sixty.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Your kidneys, your liver, they need you to work with them now. Not against them.
data.broll_query: kidney liver organs healthy function medical
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: If this video helped you, leave a comment below. Which vitamin surprised you the most?
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Was it Vitamin A? The B6 nerve damage? Or the calcium-heart connection?
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Next time, I'll show you the three vitamins most people over sixty are actually missing.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: The ones your body desperately needs but you're probably not getting enough of.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2

data.speaker: Kenzo
data.text: Until then, take care of yourself. With precision.
data.title: ep_vitamins_60_p2
